file_content.text: Sith. Colonel Nyzes. A word with you if I may.
I'm a very busy Sith. Don't waste my time.
Make it quick.
No thank you.
I'm sorry. I wasn't asking. I was just being polite.
What do you need?
A short while ago, Imperial command received word that Lady Elana Thul asked you to raid House Organa and you did not do so.
Is this correct, or have I been misinformed?
Lady Thul thought she could order me around like a servant.
I don't take orders from her.
No, that's right.
It always amazes me that you Sith can be so powerful and have absolutely no grasp of politics.
Your inaction has directly resulted in the death of Lady Elana Thul and several other prominent members of her house.
And thanks to Lady Elana's untimely demise, the Empire's plans on Alderaan have been seriously endangered.
How did it happen?
Lady Elana is dead?
How do you think? She was offered exile or death by House Organa's Jedi. She made her choice.
Do not scold me.
But no sense crying over it, right?
Oops.
You would do well to remember that the Sith cannot stand if the Empire falls.
You've been misinformed.
No, you're wrong.
Odd. My sources are usually very reliable.
And here I was all prepared to rail about how your inaction directly resulted in the death of Lady Elana and several other prominent members of Thul.
And how the Empire's plans for Alderaan are now in serious jeopardy. But since you're not the Sith.....
I suppose you'll have to find someone else to scold.
You'll have to keep looking.
I had no idea she passed away. That's a shame.
Lady Elana is dead?
Yes. House Organa's Jedi offered Lady Elana exile or death. She made her choice.
They had to know she would never choose exile.
The fools.
I'm sure they did. But she never would've had to choose if the Sith had killed the Jedi as she asked.
Where was the Empire in all of this?
And the Empire?
Elana Thul had a contingent of Imperial guardsmen, but they were no match against Jedi.
I hope you find the person responsible for her death.
Good luck finding the culprit.
I hope you give the fool responsible more than a talking-to.
Someone should be punished.
Yes. Oh, and Sith. One more thing.
You-- or rather the Sith responsible for this debacle-- would do well to remember that the Sith cannot stand if the Empire falls.
And when the time comes to report to the Grand Moff why the Republic was able to control Alderaan, I will not take the blame for Sith recklessness.
I would expect nothing less.
Naturally.
As long as we understand each other.
Maybe I should kill you so that you don't make your report.
Don't make me silence you.
I would not advise it.
Neither will I.
We'll see about that.
Good day, Sith.
